intro: Acronychia littoralis, commonly known as the coastal acronychia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the coastal regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and oval-shaped leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils, making it a valuable component of coastal vegetation.
